children.subject: I filled out the incident form with a link to one of the EECS 101 Piazza posts about 4 weeks ago, but never received a response. In June 2021, I filled out another incident form for CS 70, but also received no response.
The people responsible for the incident form are not on EECS 101, so I'm not sure there's anything we can do on here at this point.

history.content:
I talked to those who are responding to the incident forms, and while they do act on your concerns about grade issues, they feel that this is not the most effective way to handle these.

The incident form was designed to improve the climate in the EECS Department. The form itself has a long description at the top about the sorts of cases it is intended to address.

Class grades are, as some of you noted in the original discussion I saw, very much at the discretion of the instructor. So if you file an incident report, the Chair may see your comment, and they may send it to the faculty member who taught the class. But they won't be able to change the grades for your class. A perhaps more effective way to handle grades that seem unfair would be to first talk to the instructor about the issue, and if you reach an impasse, you can contact one of the EECS Grievance Officers, who this year are Michael Ball and Tom Courtade, and talk to them about the situation.
@16283? I filled out the incident form, but received no response.
